classes.name: Cipher
classes.description: Provides the functionality of a cryptographic cipher for encryption and decryption. Forms the core of the Java Cryptographic Extension (JCE) framework.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: transformation
params.description: The name of the transformation (e.g., AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding)

returns.description: A Cipher object that implements the specified transformation

methods.description: Returns a Cipher object that implements the specified transformation.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: transformation
params.description: The name of the transformation (e.g., AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding)

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider

returns.description: A Cipher object that implements the specified transformation

methods.description: Returns a Cipher object that implements the specified transformation from the specified provider.

methods.name: getMaxAllowedKeyLength

params.name: transformation
params.description: The cipher transformation

returns.description: The maximum key length in bits, or Integer.MAX_VALUE

methods.description: Returns the maximum key length for the specified transformation according to the installed JCE jurisdiction policy files.

methods.name: init

params.name: opmode
params.description: The operation mode (ENCRYPT_MODE, DECRYPT_MODE, WRAP_MODE, or UNWRAP_MODE)

params.name: key
params.description: The key for this cipher

methods.description: Initializes this cipher with a key for the specified operation mode.

methods.name: init

params.name: opmode
params.description: The operation mode (ENCRYPT_MODE, DECRYPT_MODE, WRAP_MODE, or UNWRAP_MODE)

params.name: key
params.description: The key for this cipher

params.name: params
params.description: The algorithm parameters (e.g., IvParameterSpec)

methods.description: Initializes this cipher with a key and a set of algorithm parameters.

methods.name: init

params.name: opmode
params.description: The operation mode (ENCRYPT_MODE, DECRYPT_MODE, WRAP_MODE, or UNWRAP_MODE)

params.name: key
params.description: The key for this cipher

params.name: random
params.description: The source of randomness

methods.description: Initializes this cipher with a key and a source of randomness.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The input buffer

returns.description: The new buffer with the result, or null if the cipher is a block cipher and the input data is too short

methods.description: Continues a multiple-part encryption or decryption operation, processing another data part.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The input buffer

params.name: inputOffset
params.description: The offset in input where the input starts

params.name: inputLen
params.description: The input length

returns.description: The new buffer with the result, or null if the cipher is a block cipher and the input data is too short

methods.description: Continues a multiple-part encryption or decryption operation, processing another data part from offset.

methods.name: doFinal

returns.description: The new buffer with the result

methods.description: Finishes a multiple-part encryption or decryption operation. Processes any buffered input data and applies padding if required.

methods.name: doFinal

params.name: input
params.description: The input buffer

returns.description: The new buffer with the result

methods.description: Encrypts or decrypts data in a single-part operation, or finishes a multiple-part operation. The data is processed and padded as needed.

methods.name: doFinal

params.name: input
params.description: The input buffer

params.name: inputOffset
params.description: The offset in input where the input starts

params.name: inputLen
params.description: The input length

returns.description: The new buffer with the result

methods.description: Encrypts or decrypts data in a single-part operation, or finishes a multiple-part operation, using a sub-array of the input.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The algorithm name of this cipher

methods.description: Returns the algorithm name of this Cipher object.

methods.name: getBlockSize

returns.description: The block size in bytes, or 0 if the algorithm is not a block cipher

methods.description: Returns the block size (in bytes) of this cipher.

methods.name: getOutputSize

params.name: inputLen
params.description: The input length in bytes

returns.description: The required output buffer size in bytes

methods.description: Returns the length in bytes that an output buffer would need to be in order to hold the result of the next update or doFinal operation.

methods.name: getIV

returns.description: The initialization vector, or null if the algorithm does not use an IV

methods.description: Returns the initialization vector (IV) in a new buffer.

methods.name: getParameters

returns.description: The parameters used with this cipher, or null

methods.description: Returns the parameters used with this cipher. The returned parameters may be the same that were used to initialize this cipher.

fields.name: ENCRYPT_MODE
fields.description: Constant used to initialize cipher for encryption.

fields.name: DECRYPT_MODE
fields.description: Constant used to initialize cipher for decryption.

fields.name: WRAP_MODE
fields.description: Constant used to initialize cipher for key wrapping.

fields.name: UNWRAP_MODE
fields.description: Constant used to initialize cipher for key unwrapping.

classes.name: SecretKeySpec
classes.description: Constructs a secret key from a given byte array. Implements the javax.crypto.SecretKey interface. Useful for constructing keys for algorithms that do not require key material in a provider-specific format.

params.name: key
params.description: The key material of the secret key

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The name of the secret-key algorithm (e.g., AES, DES, HmacSHA256)

constructors.description: Constructs a secret key from the given byte array.

params.name: key
params.description: The key material of the secret key

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset in key where the key material starts

params.name: len
params.description: The length of the key material

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The name of the secret-key algorithm (e.g., AES, DES, HmacSHA256)

constructors.description: Constructs a secret key from the given byte array, using the first len bytes of key starting at offset.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The name of the algorithm associated with this key

methods.description: Returns the name of the algorithm associated with this secret key.

methods.name: getFormat

returns.description: The format name (RAW)

methods.description: Returns the name of the encoding format for this secret key. Always returns "RAW".

methods.name: getEncoded

returns.description: A copy of the key material

methods.description: Returns the key material of this secret key as a byte array.

methods.name: equals

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to compare with

returns.description: True if the given object is equal to this SecretKeySpec

methods.description: Tests for equality between the specified object and this object. Two SecretKeySpec objects are equal if their key material and algorithm are the same.

methods.name: hashCode

returns.description: A hash code value for this object

methods.description: Calculates a hash code value for this object based on the key material and algorithm.

classes.name: KeyGenerator
classes.description: Provides the functionality of a symmetric key generator. Key generators are constructed using one of the getInstance factory methods.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested key algorithm (e.g., AES, DES, HmacSHA256)

returns.description: The new KeyGenerator object

methods.description: Returns a KeyGenerator object that generates secret keys for the specified algorithm.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested key algorithm

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider

returns.description: The new KeyGenerator object

methods.description: Returns a KeyGenerator object that generates secret keys for the specified algorithm from the specified provider.

methods.name: init

params.name: keysize
params.description: The key size in bits (e.g., 128, 192, 256 for AES)

methods.description: Initializes this key generator for a certain key size.

methods.name: init

params.name: keysize
params.description: The key size in bits

params.name: random
params.description: The source of randomness for this key generator

methods.description: Initializes this key generator for a certain key size, using the given source of randomness.

methods.name: init

params.name: params
params.description: The algorithm parameter specification

methods.description: Initializes this key generator with the specified parameter set.

methods.name: generateKey

returns.description: The new key

methods.description: Generates a secret key.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The algorithm name of this KeyGenerator object

methods.description: Returns the algorithm name of this KeyGenerator object.

classes.name: Mac
classes.description: Provides the functionality of a Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithm. A MAC provides a way to check the integrity of information transmitted over or stored in an unreliable medium, based on a secret key.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested MAC algorithm (e.g., HmacSHA256, HmacSHA1)

returns.description: The new Mac object

methods.description: Returns a Mac object that implements the specified MAC algorithm.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the requested MAC algorithm

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider

returns.description: The new Mac object

methods.description: Returns a Mac object that implements the specified MAC algorithm from the specified provider.

methods.name: init

params.name: key
params.description: The key for this MAC

methods.description: Initializes this Mac object with the given key.

methods.name: init

params.name: key
params.description: The key for this MAC

params.name: params
params.description: The algorithm parameters

methods.description: Initializes this Mac object with the given key and algorithm parameters.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The input byte

methods.description: Processes the given byte.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The input byte array

methods.description: Processes the given array of bytes.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The input buffer

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset in input where the input starts

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to process

methods.description: Processes the first len bytes in input, starting at offset.

methods.name: doFinal

returns.description: The MAC result

methods.description: Finishes the MAC operation. Processes any remaining buffered data and returns the computed MAC. The Mac object is reset after this call.

methods.name: doFinal

params.name: input
params.description: The data in bytes to process before finishing the MAC operation

returns.description: The MAC result

methods.description: Processes the given array of bytes and finishes the MAC operation. Equivalent to calling update(input) followed by doFinal().

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets this Mac object. The Mac can be reused to generate another MAC from the same key.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The algorithm name of this Mac object

methods.description: Returns the algorithm name of this Mac object.

methods.name: getMacLength

returns.description: The MAC length in bytes

methods.description: Returns the length of the MAC in bytes.

methods.name: clone

returns.description: A clone of this Mac object

methods.description: Returns a clone if the provider implementation is cloneable.

classes.name: CipherInputStream
classes.description: A FilterInputStream that reads data from an underlying InputStream and decrypts or decodes it using a Cipher. Useful for transparent decryption of data streams.

params.name: is
params.description: The underlying input stream to read data from

params.name: c
params.description: An initialized Cipher object

constructors.description: Constructs a CipherInputStream from an InputStream and a Cipher. The Cipher must already be initialized.

methods.name: read

returns.description: The next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached

methods.description: Reads the next byte of data from this input stream. The byte is decrypted using the cipher.

methods.name: read

params.name: b
params.description: The buffer into which the data is read

returns.description: The total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if the end of stream is reached

methods.description: Reads up to b.length bytes of data from this input stream into an array of bytes.

methods.name: read

params.name: b
params.description: The buffer into which the data is read

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in the destination array b

params.name: len
params.description: The maximum number of bytes read

returns.description: The total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if the end of stream is reached

methods.description: Reads up to len bytes of data from this input stream into an array of bytes, starting at offset off.

methods.name: available

returns.description: The number of bytes that can be read without blocking

methods.description: Returns the number of bytes that can be read from this input stream without blocking.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.

methods.name: skip

params.name: n
params.description: The number of bytes to be skipped

returns.description: The actual number of bytes skipped

methods.description: Skips n bytes of input from the bytes that can be read from this input stream without blocking.

classes.name: CipherOutputStream
classes.description: A FilterOutputStream that writes data to an underlying OutputStream and encrypts or encodes it using a Cipher. Useful for transparent encryption of data streams.

params.name: os
params.description: The underlying output stream to write data to

params.name: c
params.description: An initialized Cipher object

constructors.description: Constructs a CipherOutputStream from an OutputStream and a Cipher. The Cipher must already be initialized.

methods.name: write

params.name: b
params.description: The byte to write

methods.description: Writes the specified byte to this output stream. The byte is encrypted before being written.

methods.name: write

params.name: b
params.description: The data to write

methods.description: Writes b.length bytes from the specified byte array to this output stream.

methods.name: write

params.name: b
params.description: The data to write

params.name: off
params.description: The start offset in the data

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to write

methods.description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this output stream.

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes this output stream by forcing any buffered output bytes that have already been processed by the cipher to be written out.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this output stream and releases any system resources associated with it. Invokes the doFinal method of the cipher before closing the stream.
